line.words: Geburtstagsbräuche - Zeena und die Fettnasen.

subtitle.line: Birthday Traditions – ‘Zeena’ and Greasy Noses.
Birthday Traditions – ‘Zeena’ and Greasy Noses.
Fødselsdag og tradition – “Zeena” og fedtede næser.
Birthday Traditions – ‘Zeena’ and Greasy Noses.

line.words: Heute hat Fatima Geburtstag. Sie wird 9 Jahre alt.

subtitle.line: Today is Fatima’s Birthday. She is 9 years old.
Today is Fatima’s Birthday. She is 9 years old.
I dag er det Fatimas fødselsdag. Hun bliver 9 år.
Today is Fatima’s Birthday. She is 9 years old.

line.words: In Fatimas Schulklasse ist es Brauch ein Geburtstags Lied zu singen, wenn jemand Geburtstag hat. Und so geht es...

subtitle.line: In Fatima’s class at school the tradition is to sing ‘happy birthday’ when it is someone’s birthday. This is how they sing…
In Fatima’s class at school the tradition is to sing ‘happy birthday’ when it is someone’s birthday. This is how they sing…
I Fatimas klasse er der tradition for at synge “happy birthday”, når nogen fylder år. Sådan synger de:
In Fatima’s class at school the tradition is to sing ‘happy birthday’ when it is someone’s birthday. This is how they sing…

line.words: §Zum Geburtstag viel Glück, zum Geburtstag viel Glück, zum Geburtstag liebe Fatima, zum Geburtstag viel Glück.§

subtitle.line: §Happy Birthday to you, happy birthday to you, happy birthday dear Fatima, happy birthday to you.§
§Happy Birthday to you, happy birthday to you, happy birthday dear Fatima, happy birthday to you.§
‘Happy Birthday to you, Happy Birthday to you, Happy Birthday dear Fatima, Happy Birthday to you.’
§Happy Birthday to you, happy birthday to you, happy birthday dear Fatima, happy birthday to you.§

line.words: Fatimas Lehrer heißt Mr. Waddle. Er ist ein guter Lehrer. Ein sehr guter Lehrer. In der Tat, er ist ein fantastischer Lehrer, ein Zauberlehre.

subtitle.line: Fatima´s teacher is called Mr Waddle. He is a good teacher. A very good teacher. In fact he is a fantastic teacher, a magical teacher.
Fatima´s teacher is called Mr Waddle. He is a good teacher. A very good teacher. In fact he is a fantastic teacher, a magical teacher.
Fatimas lærer hedder Mr Waddle. Han er en god lærer. En rigtig god lærer. Faktisk er han en fantastisk lærer, en magisk lærer.
Fatima´s teacher is called Mr Waddle. He is a good teacher. A very good teacher. In fact he is a fantastic teacher, a magical teacher.

line.words: §Wenn es dein Geburtstag wäre, was würdest du dir als Geschenk wünschen?§ fragt er die Kinder alle einzeln.

subtitle.line: §If it was your birthday, what would you like to get as a present?§ he asks the children one by one.
§If it was your birthday, what would you like to get as a present?§ he asks the children one by one.
“Hvis det var din fødselsdag, hvad ville du så ønske dig?”, spørger han børnene en efter en.
§If it was your birthday, what would you like to get as a present?§ he asks the children one by one.

line.words: §ich wünsche mir einen Fußball zum Geburtstag, weil es Spaß macht.§ sagt Thomas.

subtitle.line: §For my Birthday I would like a football because it’s fun!§ says Thomas.
§For my Birthday I would like a football because it’s fun!§ says Thomas.
“Til min fødselsdag ønsker jeg mig en fordbold, fordi det er sjovt at spille!”, siger Thomas.
§For my Birthday I would like a football because it’s fun!§ says Thomas.

line.words: §Ich wünsche mir eine Puppe zum Geburtstag, weil das toll ist.§ sagt Hannah.

subtitle.line: §For my Birthday I would like a doll because it’s great!§ says Hannah.
§For my Birthday I would like a doll because it’s great!§ says Hannah.
”Til min fødselsdag ønsker jeg mig en dukke, for den er dejlig”, siger Hannah.
§For my Birthday I would like a doll because it’s great!§ says Hannah.

line.words: §Ich wünsche mir einen Drachen zum Geburtstag, weil das ausgezeichnet ist.§ sagt Louis.

subtitle.line: §For my Birthday I would like a kite because it’s excellent!§ says Louis.
§For my Birthday I would like a kite because it’s excellent!§ says Louis.
”Til min fødselsdag ønsker jeg mig en drage, for den er fremragende”, siger Louis.
§For my Birthday I would like a kite because it’s excellent!§ says Louis.

line.words: §Meiner Meinung nach macht ein Fußball mehr Spaß als ein Drachen,§ sagt Dean.

subtitle.line: §In my opinion a football is more fun than a kite,§ says Dean.
§In my opinion a football is more fun than a kite,§ says Dean.
“Efter min mening er en fodbold sjovere end en drage”, siger Dean.
§In my opinion a football is more fun than a kite,§ says Dean.

line.words: §Meiner Meinung nach ist eine Puppe langweilig, aber macht mehr Spaß als ein Fußball,§ sagt Rebecca.

subtitle.line: §In my opinion a doll is boring, but more fun than a football,§ says Rebecca.
§In my opinion a doll is boring, but more fun than a football,§ says Rebecca.
”Efter min mening er en dukke kedlig, men sjovere end en fodbold”, siger Rebecca.
§In my opinion a doll is boring, but more fun than a football,§ says Rebecca.

line.words: Mr. Waddle lehnt sich vor. Das macht er immer, bevor etwas erstaunliches vor hat.

subtitle.line: Mr Waddle leans forward. He does this when he is going to do something amazing.
Mr Waddle leans forward. He does this when he is going to do something amazing.
Mr Waddle læner sig frem. Det gør han, når han skal til at lave noget overraskende.
Mr Waddle leans forward. He does this when he is going to do something amazing.

line.words: §Geburtstage sind viel mehr als nur Geschenke. Lasst mich euch auf eine Reise mitnehmen. Eine Reise um die Welt der Geburtstage,§ sagt er.

subtitle.line: §Birthdays are much more than just presents. Let me take you on a journey. A journey around the world of birthdays,§ he says.
§Birthdays are much more than just presents. Let me take you on a journey. A journey around the world of birthdays,§ he says.
“Fødselsdage er meget mere end bare gaver. Lad mig tage jer med på en rejse. En rejse rundt i en fødselsdagsverden”, siger han.
§Birthdays are much more than just presents. Let me take you on a journey. A journey around the world of birthdays,§ he says.

line.words: §Fatima - komm und such einen Ort auf dem leuchtenden Globus aus.§

subtitle.line: §Fatima – come and choose a place on the glowing globe.§
§Fatima – come and choose a place on the glowing globe.§
”Fatima – kom og vælg et sted på den glødende globus”.
§Fatima – come and choose a place on the glowing globe.§

line.words: Mr. Waddles leuchtender Globus ist eine Zaubermaschine, mit der die Klasse überall auf der Welt hinkommen kann. Fatima zeigt mit dem Finger Auf Argentinien.

subtitle.line: Mr Waddle’s glowing globe is a magical machine that lets the class go anywhere in the world. Fatima points her finger – and chooses Argentina.
Mr Waddle’s glowing globe is a magical machine that lets the class go anywhere in the world. Fatima points her finger – and chooses Argentina.
Mr Waddles glødende globus er en magisk maskine, som lader klassen komme et hvilket som helst sted hen I verden. Fatima peger – og vælger Argentina.
Mr Waddle’s glowing globe is a magical machine that lets the class go anywhere in the world. Fatima points her finger – and chooses Argentina.

line.words: Das Klassenzimmer blitzt - kabum - und sie werden nach Argentinien transportiert.

subtitle.line: The classroom flashes – kazam – and they are transported to Argentina.
The classroom flashes – kazam – and they are transported to Argentina.
Det blinker i klasseværelset – kazam – og de kommer til Argentina.
The classroom flashes – kazam – and they are transported to Argentina.

line.words: §Hier in Argentinien feiern wir Geburtstag, indem wir so oft an den Ohrläppchen des Jungen oder des Mädchens ziehen, wie oft er oder sie schon Geburtstag hatte.§

subtitle.line: §Here in Argentina, we celebrate Birthdays by pulling the earlobes of the boy or girl for each year of their birthday.§
§Here in Argentina, we celebrate Birthdays by pulling the earlobes of the boy or girl for each year of their birthday.§
“Her i Argentina fejrer vi fødselsdag ved at hive i øreflippen på drengen eller pigen lige så mange gange, som de fylder”.
§Here in Argentina, we celebrate Birthdays by pulling the earlobes of the boy or girl for each year of their birthday.§

line.words: Sam zieht 9 mal leicht an dem Ohrläppchen von Fatima - 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9.

subtitle.line: Sam gently pulls Fatima’s earlobe 9 times – 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9.
Sam gently pulls Fatima’s earlobe 9 times – 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9.
Sam hiver forsigtigt i Fatimas øreflip 9 gange – 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9.
Sam gently pulls Fatima’s earlobe 9 times – 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9.

line.words: §Wo geht es jetzt hin?§ fragt Mr. Waddle. §Du Suchst aus, Sam.§ Sam zeigt auf Kanada.

subtitle.line: §Now where?§ Says Mr Waddle. §You choose, Sam.§ Sam points to Canada.
§Now where?§ Says Mr Waddle. §You choose, Sam.§ Sam points to Canada.
“Hvor skal vi så hen?”, siger Mr Waddle. ”Du vælger, Sam. Sam peger på Canada.
§Now where?§ Says Mr Waddle. §You choose, Sam.§ Sam points to Canada.

line.words: Das Klassenzimmer blitzt - kabum - und sie werden nach Kananda transportiert.

subtitle.line: The classroom flashes – kazam – and they are transported to Canada.
The classroom flashes – kazam – and they are transported to Canada.
Det blinker i klasseværelset – kazam – og de kommer til Canada.
The classroom flashes – kazam – and they are transported to Canada.

line.words: §Hier in einigen Teilen von Kanada wie Nova Scotia, feiern wir Geburtstag, in dem wir die Nase des Jungen oder Mädchens einfetten, damit sie zu glitschig ist und das Unglück nicht kleben bleibt,§

subtitle.line: §Here in some parts of Canada like Nova Scotia, we celebrate Birthdays by greasing the boy or girl´s nose so that they are too slippery for bad luck to catch them.§
§Here in some parts of Canada like Nova Scotia, we celebrate Birthdays by greasing the boy or girl´s nose so that they are too slippery for bad luck to catch them.§
“I nogle dele af Canada som her I Nova Scotia, fejrer vi fødselsdag ved at smøre noget fedtet på drengens eller pigens næse, så de er for glatte til at uheld kan ramme dem”.
§Here in some parts of Canada like Nova Scotia, we celebrate Birthdays by greasing the boy or girl´s nose so that they are too slippery for bad luck to catch them.§

line.words: Die Klasse tut so, als würde sie sich die Nase einfetten.

subtitle.line: The class pretend to grease their noses.
The class pretend to grease their noses.
Klassen lader som om de smører fedt på næsen.
The class pretend to grease their noses.

line.words: §Wo geht es jetzt hin?§ fragt Mr. Waddle. §Du Suchst aus, Sandrine.§ Sandrine zeigt auf Ägypten.

subtitle.line: §Now where?§ says Mr Waddle. §You choose, Sandrine.§ Sandrine points to Egypt.
§Now where?§ says Mr Waddle. §You choose, Sandrine.§ Sandrine points to Egypt.
“Hvor skal vi så hen?”, siger Mr Waddle. ”Du vælger, Sandrine.” Sandrine peger på Egypten.
§Now where?§ says Mr Waddle. §You choose, Sandrine.§ Sandrine points to Egypt.

line.words: Das Klassenzimmer blitzt - kabum - und sie werden nach Ägypten transportiert.

subtitle.line: The classroom flashes – kazam – and they are transported to Egypt.
The classroom flashes – kazam – and they are transported to Egypt.
Det blinker i klasseværelset – kazam – og de kommer til Egypten
The classroom flashes – kazam – and they are transported to Egypt.

line.words: §Hier in Ägypten feiern wir Geburtstag, indem wir das Haus mit Papier schmücken. Dieser Schmuck heißt Zeena. Wir haben eine große Party mit vielen Freunden.§ Die Klasse macht Zeena mit ihren Händen.

subtitle.line: §Here in Egypt, we celebrate Birthdays by decorating the house with paper decorations called zeena. We have a big party with lots of friends and family.§ The class make zeena with their hands.
§Here in Egypt, we celebrate Birthdays by decorating the house with paper decorations called zeena. We have a big party with lots of friends and family.§ The class make zeena with their hands.
“Her I Egypten fejrer vi fødselsdag ved at pynte huset med papirdekorationer, der hedder zeena. Vi holder en stor fest med masser af venner og familie”. Klassen laver zeena med hænderne.
§Here in Egypt, we celebrate Birthdays by decorating the house with paper decorations called zeena. We have a big party with lots of friends and family.§ The class make zeena with their hands.

line.words: §Wo geht es jetzt hin?§ fragt Mr. Waddle.§ Du Suchst aus, Harry.§ Harry zeigt auf Japan.

subtitle.line: §Now where?§ says Mr Waddle. §You choose, Harry.§ Harry points to Japan.
§Now where?§ says Mr Waddle. §You choose, Harry.§ Harry points to Japan.
“Hvor skal vi så hen?”, siger Mr Waddle. ”Du vælger, Harry.” Harry peger på Japan.
§Now where?§ says Mr Waddle. §You choose, Harry.§ Harry points to Japan.

line.words: Das Klassenzimmer blitzt - kabum - und sie werden nach Japan transportiert.

subtitle.line: The classroom flashes – kazam – and they are transported to Japan.
The classroom flashes – kazam – and they are transported to Japan.
Det blinker i klasseværelset – kazam – og de kommer til Japan.
The classroom flashes – kazam – and they are transported to Japan.

line.words: §Hier in Japan feiern wir manchmal den 7., 5. und 3. Geburtstag, in dem wir einen heiligen Schrein besuchen und beten. Bei den Jungs ist es der 3. und 5. Geburtstag und bei Mädchen ist es der 5. und 7. Geburtstag.§

subtitle.line: §Here in Japan, we sometimes celebrate the 7th, 5th and 3rd Birthdays by visiting a shrine and praying. For boys it is the 3rd and the 5th Birthday, and for girls it is the 3rd and the 7th birthday.§
§Here in Japan, we sometimes celebrate the 7th, 5th and 3rd Birthdays by visiting a shrine and praying. For boys it is the 3rd and the 5th Birthday, and for girls it is the 3rd and the 7th birthday.§
“Her I Japan fejrer vi sommetider den 7., 5. og 3. fødselsdag ved at tage til en helligdom og bede. For drenge er det den 3. og den 5. fødselsdag, og for piger er det den 3. og den 7. fødselsdag.
§Here in Japan, we sometimes celebrate the 7th, 5th and 3rd Birthdays by visiting a shrine and praying. For boys it is the 3rd and the 5th Birthday, and for girls it is the 3rd and the 7th birthday.§

line.words: §Das Geburtstagskind trägt neue Kleidung für diesen Anlass.§ Die Kinder knien nieder und beten.

subtitle.line: §The birthday boy or girl wears new clothes for the occasion.§ The children kneel and pray.
§The birthday boy or girl wears new clothes for the occasion.§ The children kneel and pray.
Den dreng eller pige, der fylder år har nyt tøj på i dagens anledning”. Børnene knæler og beder.
§The birthday boy or girl wears new clothes for the occasion.§ The children kneel and pray.

line.words: §Jetzt lasst uns zurückkehren§ sagt Mr. Waddle. Das Klassenzimmer blitzt - kabum - und sie werden nach Hause transporiert.

subtitle.line: §Now let’s return home,§ says Mr Waddle. The classroom flashes – kazam – and they are transported back home.
§Now let’s return home,§ says Mr Waddle. The classroom flashes – kazam – and they are transported back home.
“Nu må vi se at komme hjem”, siger Mr Waddle. Det blinker i klasseværelset – kazam – og de kommer hjem.
§Now let’s return home,§ says Mr Waddle. The classroom flashes – kazam – and they are transported back home.

line.words: Und in dem Klassenzimmer hängen §Zeenas§ von der Decke - und alle Kinder haben fettige Nasen!

subtitle.line: And in their classroom there are ‘zeena’ hanging from the ceiling – and all the children have greasy noses!
And in their classroom there are ‘zeena’ hanging from the ceiling – and all the children have greasy noses!
Og I klasseværelset hænger der zeena ned fra loftet – og alle børnene har fedtede næser!
And in their classroom there are ‘zeena’ hanging from the ceiling – and all the children have greasy noses!
The end.
The end.
Slut.
The end.
